span.span: The result.

summary.span: 提供包装 和 （仅使用其中之一）的值类型。

span.span: Provides a value type that wraps a and a , only one of which is used.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 一种方法可能会返回时很可能其操作的结果将是可用以同步方式，并且当它应该能够将此值类型的实例调用相当频繁，因此，分配一个新的成本每次调用都将很高的磁盘。A method may return an instance of this value type when it's likely that the result of its operation will be available synchronously, and when it's expected to be invoked so frequently that the cost of allocating a new for each call will be prohibitive. 有几个使用缺点而不是。There are tradeoffs to using a instead of a . 例如，虽然可帮助避免分配成功的结果，以同步方式是可用的情况下，它还包含两个字段，而作为引用类型是单个字段。For example, while a can help avoid an allocation in the case where the successful result is available synchronously, it also contains two fields, whereas a as a reference type is a single field. 这意味着方法调用返回两个值得数据字段的而不是一个，这是要复制的详细数据。This means that a method call returns two fields worth of data instead of one, which is more data to copy. 这也意味着，如果返回的一个方法等待 async 方法，状态机中的异步方法将为更大，因为它必须存储结构包含两个字段，而不是单个引用。It also means, that if a method that returns a is awaited within an async method, the state machine for that async method will be larger, because it must store a struct containing two fields instead of a single reference. 对于不使用异步操作使用的结果使用 await，可能会导致更复杂的编程模型，需要更多分配。For uses other than consuming the result of an asynchronous operation using await, can lead to a more convoluted programming model that requires more allocations. 例如，考虑一种方法，可以返回与常见的结果作为缓存的任务或。For example, consider a method that could return either a with a cached task as a common result or a . 如果结果的使用者想要将其用作类似的方法中或，则必须先转换为使用，从而导致会如果可以避免的分配缓存第一个位置中已使用。If the consumer of the result wants to use it as a in a method like or , the must first be converted to a using , leading to an allocation that would have been avoided if a cached had been used in the first place. 在这种情况下，应为任何异步方法的默认选择以返回或。As such, the default choice for any asynchronous method should be to return a or . 仅当性能分析证明物有所值应而不是使用。Only if performance analysis proves it worthwhile should a be used instead of a . 非泛型版本不推荐用于大多数方案。The non generic version of is not recommended for most scenarios. 属性应该用于在方法返回退回这种情况中的已成功完成单一实例以同步方式并成功完成。The property should be used to hand back a successfully completed singleton in the case where a method returning a completes synchronously and successfully. > [!NOTE] > 利用开始，支持类型C#7.0，和不受任何版本的 Visual Basic。The use of the type is supported starting with C# 7.0, and is not supported by any version of Visual Basic.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果此包装一个成功的结果，此属性直接返回。If this wraps a successful result, this property returns it directly. 换行时的行为类似于访问的行为已包装的任务： 如果任务尚未完成，访问属性阻止调用线程，直到它完成; 如果任务已完成已成功，该属性返回结果;如果任务已出错或被取消，访问属性引发异常。If it wraps a , the behavior of is similar to the behavior of accessing on the wrapped task: if the task hasn't completed, accessing the property blocks the calling thread until it completes; if the task has completed successfully, the property returns the result; if the task has faulted or was cancelled, accessing the property throws an exception. 引发的异常不包装在，这是不同的行为在相同情况。The thrown exception is not wrapped in an , which is different from the behavior of in the same situation.
